item.title: 中国可能准备在 2050 年前使用核聚变发电
item.description: 据中国国有原子能公司称，中国的目标是到 2050 年将核聚变技术商业化，用于无排放发电。【原文：China aims to commercialize nuclear fusion technology for use in emissions-free power generation by 2050, according to the country’s state-owned atomic company.】

item.title: 中国国会为全球大宗商品价格指明方向
item.description: 中国的年度代表大会是在工业产能过剩、房地产市场依然不景气以及与美国的贸易战有可能恶化的背景下召开的。这个全球最大的原材料消费国就所有这些挑战做出的决定，可能会对全球大宗商品市场产生决定性影响。【原文：China’s annual congress meets against a backdrop of industrial overcapacity, a still-floundering property market and the prospect of a worsening trade war with the US. Decisions on all these challenges by the world’s biggest consumer of raw materials could be decisive for global commodities markets.】

item.title: 中国电动汽车制造商在东南亚面临现实考验
item.description: 最近一个星期四的上午，河内的中国电动汽车巨头比亚迪公司（BYD Co.而就在几公里外，越南电动汽车制造商 VinFast Auto Ltd. 的一家经销商店里却热闹非凡，新款车型吸引了众多潜在买家。【原文：On a recent Thursday morning in Hanoi, Chinese electric vehicle giant BYD Co. began the day with a showroom devoid of customers. Just a few kilometers away, a dealership for upstart Vietnamese EV maker VinFast Auto Ltd. was buzzing, with would-be buyers pouring over new models.】

item.title: 南非唯一的核电站因机组跳闸而停机
item.description: 南非唯一的核电设施的一个机组意外跳闸，导致整个设施停运，使本已紧张的国家电网供应更加紧张。【原文：A unit at South Africa’s sole nuclear power facility unexpectedly tripped, taking the whole facility offline and further stretching supply to the nation’s already-constrained grid.】

item.title: 煤炭的四年低点隐藏着即将到来的全球供应挤压
item.description: 如今，全球能源价格的疲软掩盖了世界上消耗量最大的电力来源的一个截然不同的未来。【原文：Languishing global prices today mask a very different future for the world’s most-consumed source of power.】

item.title: 澳大利亚绿党希望禁止伐木，扮演选举 "造王者 "角色
item.description: 如果即将举行的联邦选举没有产生明确的获胜者，澳大利亚绿党将要求停止在原生林中伐木，并受邀加入工党政府。【原文：Australia’s Greens will demand the end of logging in native forests if upcoming federal elections finish without a clear winner and the party is invited to join the Labor government.】

item.title: 富国银行在华尔街退潮之际放弃零净值目标
item.description: 富国银行（Wells Fargo & Co.【原文：Wells Fargo & Co. has formally abandoned its net zero commitment, marking a major reversal from a key climate objective.】

item.title: 意大利向恢复核能发电迈出第一步
item.description: 意大利总理乔治亚-梅洛尼（Giorgia Meloni）的政府希望推翻长达数十年的核电禁令，意大利内阁已批准了一项旨在重新引入核能发电的新法律框架。【原文：Italy’s cabinet has approved a new legal framework aimed at reintroducing nuclear power generation, as Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni’s government looks to overturn a decades-long ban.】

item.title: Heat Pump Enthusiasts Invite Strangers to Tour Their Homes
item.description: To many, heat pumps are an unfamiliar and intimidating low-carbon technology. A UK program is giving people the opportunity to get acquainted before they commit.

item.title: UK Enters Final Stage of Contest for Next-Generation Reactors
item.description: The UK entered the final stage of a process to select small modular reactor technologies that may be key to the country’s net zero goals.

item.title: Kenyan Firm Plans 195MW Solar Plant to Produce Green Ammonia
item.description: Kaptagat Green Ammonia Park Ltd. is seeking a license to develop a 195 megawatt solar power plant in Kenya to power the production of 40,000 tons of green ammonia annually.

item.title: London Mayor Kicks Off Process to Ban Traffic on Oxford Street
item.description: London Mayor Sadiq Khan began a consultation Friday on a contentious plan to pedestrianize Oxford Street in a move to regenerate the city’s busiest shopping destination.

item.title: 中国在能源目标上的退步使气候目标面临风险
item.description: 近二十年来，中国一直通过监测经济增长所消耗的能源来对经济进行分级。这一做法将于今年结束，但与官方目标相差甚远。【原文：For nearly two decades, China has graded the economy by monitoring the amount of energy it consumes to deliver growth. That is set to end this year — far short of official targets.】

item.title: 各国支持每年 2,000 亿美元的扭转自然损失计划
item.description:
联合国在罗马召开的会谈就融资战略达成一致，但将建立新的全球生物多样性基金的决定推迟到 2028 年

。【原文：

UN-convened talks in Rome agreed on a finance strategy, though delayed until 2028 a decision on establishing a new global biodiversity fund

】

item.title: 美国气象局至少有 880 名员工被解雇
item.description: 随着特朗普政府采取行动缩小联邦政府的规模，美国负责天气和气候研究的最高机构的数百名员工被解雇。【原文：Hundreds of employees at the top US agency overseeing weather and climate research were fired as the Trump administration moves to shrink the size of the federal government.】

item.title: 管道安全局高级领导人在特朗普推动下离职
item.description: 根据彭博社看到的一份备忘录，负责监督美国输油管道系统安全的美国政府重要监管机构一半以上的高级管理人员将在未来三个月内离职。【原文：More than half of the senior executives at a key US government regulatory body responsible for overseeing safety of the US pipeline system will depart the agency in the next three months, according to a memo seen by Bloomberg.】

item.title: 高盛称已实现 80% 的可持续金融目标
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Goldman Sachs Group Inc. said it’s more than 80% of the way to meeting its 2030 goal of putting $750 billion toward supporting the transition to a low-carbon economy and advancing what it calls “inclusive growth.”】

item.title: 私募股权投资的零排放赌注带来大量零回报
item.description: 私募股权公司在可再生能源领域的押注面临着清醒的反思。简而言之，很多初创企业的价值还不如他们的赞助商为其支付的费用，其中一些零排放企业的价值甚至为零。【原文：Private equity firms face a sober reckoning on their renewable energy bets. Simply put, a lot of those startups aren’t worth nearly what their sponsors paid for them, and some of those zero-emission ventures are just plain zeroes.】

item.title: 可彻底改变电池技术的三种新方法
item.description:
依靠鸡毛和食物残渣等材料的新技术有助于减少能源存储的环境足迹。【原文：

New technologies relying on materials such as chicken feathers and food waste can help cut the environmental footprint of energy storage.

】

item.title: 英国实现零净排放的成本为何越来越低？
item.description:
气候变化委员会本周为英国设定了更严格的排放目标，但委员会表示，实现这些目标的成本将低于五年前的预期。【原文：

The Climate Change Committee set tighter emissions targets for the UK this week, yet it says the costs of hitting these goals will be lower than it anticipated five years ago.

】

item.title: SRT 20 亿美元投资组合吸引投资者参与非洲交易
item.description: 私人投资者正在排队等待一项旨在帮助将更多资金投入非洲发展项目的资本减免交易。【原文：Private investors are lining up for a capital-relief deal designed to help channel more funds into development projects in Africa.】

item.title: 高盛 AM 推出首个生物多样性债券基金
item.description: 高盛资产管理公司（Goldman Sachs Asset Management）正在为债券投资者推出首只生物多样性基金，并称此举将为迄今为止由其他资产类别主导的市场提供一种新产品。【原文：Goldman Sachs Asset Management is launching its first biodiversity fund for bond investors, in a move it says provides a new product to a market that’s so far been dominated by other asset classes.】

item.title: 英国碳捕集投资因规则不确定而受阻
item.description: Drax Group Plc 呼吁在其英格兰北部的生物质发电厂加强碳污染控制投资之前，要有更多的监管确定性。【原文：Drax Group Plc called for more regulatory certainty before it steps up investments in carbon pollution controls at its biomass plant in northern England.】

item.title: AXA 首席执行官称需要采取预防措施以保持房屋保险的可负担性
item.description: 一位知名保险业高管表示，在受气候变化影响的地区，控制财产保险价格上涨的最好办法是减轻自然灾害的影响。【原文：A leading insurance executive said the best way to keep price increases in check for property insurance in regions exposed to climate change is to mitigate the impact of natural disasters.】

item.title: 先别敲响德国绿波的丧钟
item.description:
美国的工业巨头们相信清洁技术是未来的最佳选择。这应该成为弗里德里希-默茨坚持气候政策的动力。【原文：

The nation’s industrial giants believe clean technology is the best bet for the future. That should be an incentive for Friedrich Merz to stay the course on climate policy.  

】

item.title: 为什么（几乎）每个人现在都讨厌 ESG？
item.description:
"人们仍然在做这项工作，只是现在不那么张扬了，"记者赛杰尔-基山（Saijel Kishan）在本周的Zero节目中谈到企业ESG措施时说道。【原文：

“People are still doing the work, but just not being so vocal about it now,” reporter Saijel Kishan says of corporate ESG measures this week on Zero.

】

item.title: 澳大利亚绿色氢能前景在大选前黯淡下来
item.description: 据项目评级机构 HySights Pte Ltd 称，如果澳大利亚政府在 5 月中旬的大选中落败，那么澳大利亚成为绿色氢气主要生产国的雄心壮志可能会走上与美国放弃可再生能源类似的轨迹。【原文：Australia’s ambitions to become a major producer of green hydrogen may follow a similar trajectory to the US’s move away from renewable energy if the government loses elections due by mid-May, according to project ratings agency HySights Pte Ltd.】

item.title: 重启世界顶级核电站面临延迟风险，日本电力公司股价下跌
item.description: 东京电力公司（Tokyo Electric Power Co.）的股价创下近五个月来的最大跌幅，此前该公司表示将推迟反应堆的升级改造，从而有可能使重启世界最大核电站的计划推迟。【原文：Tokyo Electric Power Co. slumped the most in almost five months after the utility said it would delay upgrades at reactors, risking to push back plans to restart the world’s biggest nuclear power plant.】

item.title: 西南航空公司在清洁燃料和气候倡议方面的退缩
item.description:
该运营商正在解雇两个关键气候团队的员工，并试图出售一家可再生能源初创公司。【原文：

The carrier is dismissing employees on two key climate teams and trying to sell a renewables startup.

】

item.title: 众议院投票废除甲烷费，共和党瞄准拜登规则
item.description: 美国国会众议院周三投票决定废除美国对石油和天然气生产商排放的会导致气候变暖的甲烷征收的新费用，这表明国会共和党人开始采用一种强有力的立法工具来废除拜登政府后期通过的法规。【原文：The House voted Wednesday to repeal a new US fee on climate-warming methane emissions from oil and gas producers as congressional Republicans begin to deploy a powerful legislative tool to roll back regulations adopted late in the Biden administration.】
